required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of CG100649 Versus Celecoxib in Osteoarthritis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Multicenter, Noninferiority, Phase II Repeat Dose Study of CG100649 Versus Celecoxib in Osteoarthritis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a double-blind, randomized, multicenter, phase 2b, noninferiority comparison of two active dose levels of CG100649 vs. a standard anti-arthritic dose of celecoxib (Celebrex).

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a double-blind, randomized, multicenter, noninferiority, phase 2 study. Subjects will discontinue current medications (NSAID or COX-2 inhibitor) 5-14 days prior to randomization. Paracetamol (acetaminophen; â‰¤2 gm/day) may be used for breakthrough pain. Other NSAIDs, COX-2 inhibitors, opioids, and corticosteroids may not be used at any time during this study. Only subjects recording average WOMAC pain score of 4 to 8 on a 0-10 numerical rating scale during the washout period and meeting all other inclusion criteria will be randomized into the study.
Male and female adults, ages 20 and older, with a history of osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee or hip diagnosed by radiograph obtained within the past 20 years and with pain at least 3 months from OA can participate in this study. OA must be confirmed by radiographs and diagnosed according to American College of Rheumatology (ACR) guidelines. Subjects must qualify as ACR global functional status I, II, or III (excluding IV) and Kellgren-Lawrence grade 1, 2 or 3 (excluding grade 4).
Subjects meeting screening criteria will be randomized to receive 28 days dosing of an active dose of CG100649 or comparator (celecoxib).
Antiarthritic efficacy will be evaluated by changes in the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities (WOMAC) OA index completed on Day 1 (Baseline) and on Days 14, 28 and 42. The WOMAC pain subscale will be evaluated at screening and on Days 1, 7, 14, 21, 28, 35 and 42.
All doses will be administered orally once daily in the morning. There are 3 planned treatment arms (2 with active compound + one comparator (celecoxib) group) with n=44 per treatment arm. Total number of subjects will be 132.
Treatment A: CG100649: 2 mg/day (Days 1-28); Treatment B: CG100649: 4 mg/day (Days 1-28); Treatment C: celecoxib: 200 mg/day (Days 1-28); Active and comparator medications will have identical appearance.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint will be the change in "Pain" (average WOMAC-Pain score in the index joint) at Day 28 vs. Baseline (Day 1 using the ITT population).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time course for change in WOMAC OA Index
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the sum of the WOMAC OA Index on Days 14, 28 and 42 vs. pre-dose Baseline WOMAC (repeated measures ANOVA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time course for change in WOMAC stiffness & function subscales
secondary_outcome.description: Change in subscales of WOMAC assessment (stiffness, physical function) on Days 14, 28 and 42 vs. Baseline WOMAC

secondary_outcome.measure: Time course for change in WOMAC pain subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the "Pain" subscale on Days 7, 14, 21, 28, 35 and 42 vs. pre-dose Baseline
Subject's Global Assessment ("How Do You Feel?")
Withdrawals due to lack of analgesic efficacy or non-compliance rates

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in use of rescue medication
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total paracetamol used for rescue medication

arm_group.description: capsule, 4 mg, once daily for 28 days

intervention.description: capsule, 2 mg, once daily for 28 days
capsule, celecoxib 200 mg, once daily for 28 days
capsule, 4 mg, once daily for 28 days
